item.title: How to Write Yourself Into the Great American Novel
item.description:
A couple years ago, a lot of folks believed that victory in 2010 would be a cakewalk. Led by Tea Party activists, the GOP picked up over 800 legislative seats, state and federal, in the 2010 off-year election. Rumors of the Republican Party’s death had been greatly exaggerated.
Or so it seemed. Novels and action movies involve a hero’s quest. The main character hopes to accomplish something. Dorothy wants to return to Kansas.

item.title: 7 Warning Signs That Obama’s Imploding
item.description:
Hurricane Isaac smiled on the Republicans in Tampa and delivered more misery to New Orleans and its surroundings. That was just one of the ominous signs that 2012 is shaping up to be a forgettable year for Democrats, especially for Barack Obama.
Here’s seven more warning signs that Obama’s 6-year campaign is about to implode: 1. Torrential Rains Wipe the Face of Mount Obamamore Not that weather plays favorites, but you have wonder.
